 simple: science has no materialistic origin of anything: dna, rna, brains, eyes, kidneys, potassium, sodium, any of the billions of compounds, time, space, matter, consciosness -- nothing.
 
 That only leaves one explanation: special creation by non-materialistic means.
 
 I have a question for you...if God really DID create everything from scratch, how would you ever accept it? For example, if God were to make a fully-grown tree (rings and all) from nothing, how would you -- how could you -- be convinced of this fact?
 
 If you think about it, only materialistic mechanisms could be proven (by scientific method, of course) -- prior miracles, on the other hand, certainly cannot be. And since you have offered up no proof for your materialistic mechanism it only leaves one thing left: special creation.

If you think about it, only materialistic mechanisms could be proven (by scientific method, of course) -- prior miracles, on the other hand, certainly cannot be. And since you have offered up no proof for your materialistic mechanism it only leaves one thing left: special creation.

 
 Nope it means only that immaterial causes must be sufficient to explain all material outcomes. It does not mean special creation as there may be other nonmaterial causes other than a GOD or a special creator.
 
 On the other hand its certainly clear that in some cases material causes do explain material outcomes. This does not prove necessarily that such is always the case, but it does prove that special creation does not explain everything and material causes DO explain some things. So far the score is about 99.99999% material causes and approximately 0% nonmaterial causes. Subject to alteration as new data comes in of course.
